definition: to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)

sentences.english: Will it receive heartfelt support from the people concerned?
sentences.chinese: 有没有得到有关人群发自内心的拥护？

sentences.english: But this witness must come from a heart that is willing to give without getting anything in return.
sentences.chinese: 但是见证者必须发自内心的只求付出不求回报。

sentences.english: A short, heavy arrow with a thick head, used especially with a crossbow.
sentences.chinese: 一种发自石弓的四面刃头的箭。

sentences.english: It said "From the star keeper to The Gospel Church".
sentences.chinese: 信封上写着“发自星星灯守护人，写给福音教堂。”

sentences.english: I give my apology sincerely to you all, unreservedly and with my heart.
sentences.chinese: 我发自肺腑地毫无保留地向你们所有的人道歉。

sentences.english: Behind it, lingular arterial trunk arised from left inferior lobar artery.
sentences.chinese: 其后方，舌动脉干发自左肺下叶动脉。

sentences.english: Alleluia, every person must show love and affection from the bottom of heart.
sentences.chinese: 哈利路亚，每个人都必须发自内心地表达爱情。

sentences.english: Then I smiled. And my smile was as wide and warm as the one he smiled in return.
sentences.chinese: 然后，我笑了，他也回以同样温暖发自内心的微笑。

sentences.english: He datelines his reports New York.
sentences.chinese: 他注明他的报道发自纽约。
我发自肺腑的谢谢你们。

sentences.english: Actually, natural beauty comes from within.
sentences.chinese: 实际上，自然美是发自内心的。

sentences.english: When you get in God, you have enthusiasm deep in your heart.
sentences.chinese: 保持热情就是“与神同在”，你的热情发自你的内心。

sentences.english: Before my speech, allow me to say a few words from the bottom of my heart.
sentences.chinese: 演讲前，请允许我说几句发自肺腑的话。

sentences.english: You Can Tell Me is a simple folk ballad from the heart.
sentences.chinese: 你可以告诉我》是一首发自内心的简单的抒情歌。

sentences.english: We think temptation lies around us, but God says it begins within us.
sentences.chinese: 我们以为诱惑是在我们四周，但神说它发自我们心内。

definition: in the depth of one's soul
to reveal (indirectly, implicitly)/to show (interest, contempt etc) by means of one's actions, tone of voice etc
variant of 戰慄|战栗[zhan4 li4]
arising involuntarily (idiom); spontaneous/to spring up unbidden (of emotion)
